Utterance: Hi! It’s so nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been really good. I practiced saying no a couple of times, and it felt great!
That’s amazing! Can you share how those experiences went for you?
Sure! I told a friend I couldn’t make it to an event, and they were really understanding.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re becoming more comfortable with setting boundaries. How did that feel?
It felt empowering. I realized I don’t have to please everyone all the time.
Exactly! It’s about prioritizing your own needs. Have you faced any challenges while practicing this?
A little. I still feel guilty sometimes, but I’m working on it.
That’s a normal feeling, especially when it’s new. It’s important to remind yourself that your needs are valid. Have you found any strategies to cope with that guilt?
I’ve been trying to reframe my thoughts, like reminding myself that I’m allowed to take care of myself.
That’s a great strategy! Reframing can help shift your perspective. How has your meditation practice been going?
I tried a new technique called loving-kindness meditation, and I really liked it.
That’s wonderful! Loving-kindness meditation can be a beautiful way to cultivate compassion. How did it impact you?
It made me feel more connected to myself and others. I found it really soothing.
That’s a lovely outcome. Would you like to incorporate this technique more regularly into your routine?
Yes, I think I’ll do that!
Great! It sounds like you’re making significant strides in your self-care practices. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I want to continue exploring how to balance work and personal life.
Absolutely! What specific challenges are you facing in that area?
I often find myself working late, and it cuts into my personal time.
That’s a common struggle. Have you thought about setting specific work hours for yourself?
I have, but I’m worried about falling behind.
It’s understandable to feel that way, but setting boundaries can actually enhance your productivity. How about we set a goal for you to establish a work cut-off time this week?
That sounds like a good idea. I’ll try to stop working by 6 PM.
Perfect! Let’s discuss how that goes in our next session. Thank you for sharing your progress today.
Thank you! I’m feeling more empowered with each session.
I’m so glad to hear that! Take care, and I look forward to seeing you next time!
Goodbye!
